metadata.title: CVE-2014-7935 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in browser/speech/tts_message_filter.cc in theSpeech implementation in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via vectors involving utterances from a closed tab.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068').
